p: Interestingly, SINV-14 abundance was much higher in a sample prepared from a dissected brain compared to those from the whole body (Tables 1 and 2). Considering the abundance of all segments, SINV-14 from the brain sample was 17-fold more abundant compared with cox1 gene, whereas abundance of those samples prepared from whole body varied 0.135 to 2.69-fold higher than cox1 (Table 2). Moreover, the abundance of segments was asymmetric (Fig. 4C). The reads mapping on RNA1 were significantly more abundant, followed by RNA3 and RNA4, with RNA2 the least abundant (Fig. 4C).
